import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# importing the libraries
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
source.23825705:
age=data['Q1'].iloc[1:].sort_values(ascending=True)
fig=px.histogram(data,x=age,color=age,template='plotly_dark')
fig.update_layout(
    title="Age group of Kaggle users",
    xaxis_title="Age group")
fig.show()
source.7908da9b:
gender=data['Q2'].iloc[1:]
fig=px.pie(gender,names=gender,template='plotly_dark')
fig.update_layout(
    title="Gender distribution of Kaggle users",
    xaxis_title="Gender")
fig.show()
source.c1d066e2:
# gender by age group
fig=px.histogram(data,x=age,color=gender,template='plotly_dark')
fig.update_layout(
    title="Age group of Kaggle users",
    xaxis_title="Age group")
fig.show()
source.1bc48117:
ed=data['Q4'].iloc[1:]
fig = px.pie(ed, names=ed, title='Formal education of Kagglers',width=1200,height=600,template='plotly_dark')
fig.show()
source.44463d72:
job=data['Q5'].iloc[1:]
fig=px.histogram(data,y=job,color=job,width=1200, height=600 ,template='plotly_dark',orientation='h')
fig.update_layout(title='Profession of Kaggle users',
                 xaxis_title='Profession')
fig.show()
source.77dd1cd5:
years=data['Q6'].iloc[1:]
fig=px.histogram(data,y=years,color=years,width=1200, height=600 ,template='plotly_dark',orientation='h')
fig.update_layout(title='Years of coding experience',
                 xaxis_title='Years')
fig.show()
source.628661c4:
comp=data['Q25'].iloc[1:].dropna()
fig=px.histogram(data,y=comp,color=comp,width=1200, height=600,template='plotly_dark',orientation='h')
fig.update_layout(title='Current Yearly Compensation (USD)',
                 xaxis_title='Compensation')
fig.show()
source.833fbabc: We can see that most frequently occuring is '0-999' since most of us are students , interesting to see that 58 people have yearly compensation greater than 1 million

source.ceae6f7f:
# Kaggle Survey (2021) Exploratory data analysis with plotly

In this notebook we are gonna do exploratory data analysis on the Kaggle Survey (2021) dataset with the help of plotly
source.2a6b8c54:
### In which country do you currently reside?
![](https://www.i-sight.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/iStock-466580732-640x300.jpg)
source.d114f9c9:
### For how many years have you been writing code and/or programming?
![](https://i.pinimg.com/736x/5e/f1/f2/5ef1f2339b766b9c15ab11432f543fa9.jpg)
source.43b1daae: As expected, most of the users hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree (around 10k each)
source.262633a0:
### What type of computing platform do you use most often for your data science projects? 
![](https://images.martechadvisor.com/images/uploads/content_images/best_cloud_computing_platforms_for_midsized_businesses_5c473d795ab87.jpg)
source.0d882db4: We can see that most of us are beginners (like me) who have 0-3 years of coding experience , surprisingly there are 1032 people who have never written code.
source.f986517d:
### 'In what industry is your current employer/contract (or your most recent employer if retired)?'
![](https://images.livemint.com/rf/Image-621x414/LiveMint/Period1/2016/01/04/Photos/sector-web-km7G--621x414@LiveMint.jpg)
source.59c2a879: Most of us prefer laptop and Personal computers to code
source.8625c72a: We can see that most of the users are still student (26.2%) and Profession wise most of them are Data Scientists (13.9%)
source.10e2794f:
We found many interesting insights from the dataset , you can explore more interesting insights from the dataset as i didn't visualize every question on survey.

source.f3f8e172: As expected , most of the users are from Computer/Technology industry and Academics/Education since most of us are students
